title: Jovica Kolb
text:
Jovica Kolb (, born 24 November 1963) is a <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Kolb played mostly as defending <a href="Midfielder%20%28association%20football%29">midfielder</a> in the <a href="Yugoslav%20First%20League">Yugoslav First League</a> for <a href="FK%20Zemun">FK Zemun</a>, <a href="FK%20Partizan">FK Partizan</a> and <a href="FK%20Sutjeska%20Nik%C5%A1i%C4%87">FK Sutjeska Nikšić</a>, before moving to Belgium, in 1990, where he played with <a href="K.F.C.%20Verbroedering%20Geel">K.F.C. Verbroedering Geel</a> until 1998.
With Partizan, he was the national champion, winning the <a href="1985%E2%80%9386%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">1985–86 Yugoslav First League</a> and <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20Yugoslav%20First%20League">1986–87 Yugoslav First League</a>. Kolb also won a national Cup and national Supercup in 1989.
